messages.subject: Re:[Unschooling-dotcom] The Age Thing (was Friends in the Neighborhood)
messages.msgSnippet: ... My eldest knows his full name, as well as mine and my husband s.  SO that is all he needs for now if he gets lost.  Why on earth would his age be Vital
messages.messageBody:
>Nanci,
>I am so glad someone else doesn't push the age thing with their kids. I thought maybe I was the only one who didn't teach my child his age, or how to 'high-five'
>Cindy L.

My eldest knows his full name, as well as mine and my husband's. SO that is all he needs for now if he gets lost. Why on earth would his age be "Vital" information that he would need to know? He doesn't care, and when people ask him and he does not answer, I do it for him.

Anyway, if he ever gets lost and they need to call his name and age over a loudspeaker or some such, I would hope that the adults he is is the custody of are intelligent enough to hazard a reasonable guess. I can't think of any other time when he would "need" to know. He doesn't even count yet.

Nanci K.
